intro: Chrysoscias pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered chrysoscia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Native to arid regions of southern Africa, it thrives in rocky soils and dry climates. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
